title: Right-click "Fill password" option shows even when Firefox Password Manager is disabled *and* LastPass istalled
content:
A small issue but an annoying one:

I have my options set not to save logins or ask to fill passwords, and have no such data saved in Firefox. I use LastPass for all of this, and its Firefox extension is working pretty well. The issue is that any time I right-click in a password field to get the LastPass options, there in the menu above them, the very first item, is Firefox's own "Fill password", which of course does nothing because I have saved nothing for it to use.

I used to click on this regularly by mistake. After long use I've finally developed the reflex to ignore it and go to the bottom of that list where the LastPass commands are, but it should not be appearing at all. First, because I've already set the options to say I do not want to use the password manager, and second, because there is another password manager in place, and Firefox should only ever use one at a time to prevent conflicts.

If there's anything I can do to fix this, I'd love to know about it, but I suspect it has to be a change request, and I can't find out from this site how to submit those. Please advise.
creator: fastauntie1

title: accessing a website, I go through several levels of menus, and then it stalls, and will not land on the next level
content:
I am trying to change the password of my website. I am at the server site, I go through several levels, I choose the next level which will take me to the "change password" level, and the little symbol just spins, and will not advance to this last level. what is causing this? The browser? the OS? something else?

Thank you for your help!
creator: leslun7

title: Coupon pop-up doesn't pop
content:
Firefox 82.0.2 Win 7

Options->Privacy & Security->Block Pop-up off.

Pizza pop-up doesn't pop-up in Firefox but does work in Internet Explorer. This occurs on other sites also. Is there anything that I need to do to fix the issue?

The URL used is: https://www.valpak.com/coupons/printable/northwood-pizza/140995

(Good Pizza's)
creator: slipbits

title: Make it stop moving my bookmarks
content: In the recent past, Firefox has started automatically alphabetizing my bookmarks. I don't want it to. I put them in the order that I like them. It's very frustrating. I was using the bookmarks editor and as I was arranging the bookmarks, within seconds they would automatically go back to alphabetical order. How do I make that stop?
creator: rayzanon
